text: Majahadpur is a village in Kapurthala district of Punjab State, India. It is located from Kapurthala, which is both district and sub-district headquarters of Majahadpur. The village is administrated by a Sarpanch who is an elected representative of village as per the constitution of India and Panchayati raj (India). == Demography == According to the report published by Census India in 2011, Majahadpur has 70 houses with the total population of 384 persons of which 207 are male and 177 females. Literacy rate of Majahadpur is 71.59%, lower than the state average of 75.84%. The population of children in the age group 0–6 years is 39 which is 10.16% of the total population. Child sex ratio is approximately 950, higher than the state average of 846. == Population data == {|class="wikitable sortable" ! Particulars !! Total !!
